programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Wild UK
programme.desc: Colin Stafford-Johnson and Lucy Cooke examine wildlife in cities, observing a seabird with a liking for high-rise living in Newcastle and the red fox's urban habits in Brighton. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Lucy Alexander explore a Cornish farmhouse with stunning coastal views, a garden flat in Essex and a Grade II-listed Georgian property in Kent. All of the buildings are being sold at auction and are in need of modernisation, and the presenters talk to the new owners about their renovation plans after the sales, before checking on their progress a few months later.(n)

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: Chris Bavin and Gloria Hunniford assess the risk posed by saturated fats, and contemplate whether there an easy way for a person to switch off their appetite. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville test out claims that airlines are snooping on customer's flight searches in order to hike up fares. Plus, Simon Calder offers tips on visiting Dubai. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross hosts as two teams seek items of value at a wet and windy Newark antiques fair, hoping to profit from their purchases later on at auction. Experts Charles Hanson and Phillip Serrell lend a hand with their buying decisions.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: There is concern over whether the costly christening party will pass off peacefully. Relations are strained between Sean and Adrijan, while Brian seeks to reconcile with his wife.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: With a budget of £375,000 to play with, Ginny Buckley joins in the search for a rural home in north Devon with adjoining land for animals. During her time in the county, Ginny joins the harvest at a traditional Devonshire orchard where over 70 of the country's heritage apple varieties are grown.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore oversees the renovation of a sewing machine, a tin bath and a box of old taps acquired from a tip in Surrey. Artist blacksmith Bex takes on the challenge of the bath, turning it into a designer delight, while the sewing machine is transformed by furniture guru Rupert, and Sarah takes on the taps herself. The hope is that all three items will secure a profit thanks to their overhaul.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team value antiques at Wrest Park, Bedfordshire, as experts Christina Trevanion and Anita Harper take a look at the collectibles brought in by the public. Paul also takes a stroll down the high street of Amersham to explore the market town's history.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Series celebrating inspirational farming families and the rural events where they showcase their hard work, as they try to win the top prizes. The Cheddar-making Clothier family and goat's cheese-maker Roger compete against the cream-of-the-crop at the prestigious Global Cheese Awards at Frome. Narrated by Bill Paterson.(n)

programme.title: Thief Trackers
programme.desc: GPS technology helps the team members follow a man has stolen a tablet computer and they track him over a thousand miles to Warsaw and back, eventually catching up with him at a London airport. In Bath, a man gets his much-loved Land Rover returned after a police chase across to the Welsh border, and staff at a traffic management company are glad that they fitted trackers to their vans when one of then get stolen.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As Carmel prepares for her date with Max, Denise realises what is going on - but her friend insists she is going out with another man, not Max. Later, the pair enjoy a romantic evening which ends up back at a hotel - where one thing leads to another. Shirley overhears Mick and Fi discussing her future at the Vic, and upset she tells Mick she is leaving the business. Kush and Shakil talk about their mother's divorce, and Sonia thanks Ted for helping out with Dot.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: The neighbourhood prepares for a wedding, and Granville gets into the spirit of things by putting up a large display to bring a bit of cheeriness to his shop window. However, the reluctant groom has cold feet, and it falls to the miserly shopkeeper to ensure he makes it to the church on time. The marital atmosphere also has a marked effect on Mrs Featherstone, who steps up her search for a fourth husband - with Granville and Mr Newbold finding themselves likely candidates to be the next lucky man.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back over his career. There's a dead body down at the Phoenix Club, John and Kayleigh have an uninvited passenger, and Peter wows an audience of 15,000 with his shovel. Featuring an appearance by Queen. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Cathy seems reluctant to reveal any information about her new boyfriend, Mark refuses to talk about why his wife has thrown him out, and Dermot lies to his fiancee's parents about his job - all of which makes Agnes feel her family is becoming too secretive. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy play hot-tub fantasy date with Anna and Toby - and soon find themselves landing in hot water. One-time Spice Girl Emma Bunton and Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent appear as themselves, alongside regulars Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.(n)

programme.title: The Sentinel
programme.desc: A secret service agent is convinced a member of a neo-Nazi militant group has infiltrated the White House. But his attempt to investigate comes to a halt when he is framed for murder and blackmailed over his affair with the president's wife. As he battles to clear his name, his former protege is given the task of bringing him to justice. Spy thriller, starring Michael Douglas, Kiefer Sutherland, Eva Longoria and Kim Basinger.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Donal Skehan takes on hosting duties this weekend, as Greg James joins him in the studio kitchen to sample dishes prepared by chefs Glyn Purnell and Jose Pizarro.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain explores the culinary traditions of the Peak District and surrounding areas, beginning by putting her own twist on the classic Bakewell tart. She then joins Ian Barrett to learn how to make Derbyshire oatcakes, before using them as a casing for her potato and dill samosas.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The teams head to Oswestry in Shropshire, where experts Jonathan Pratt and David Harper are on hand to assist in the search for treasures. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott visits Cotehele House in Calstock, Cornwall, and looks at a fascinating time-teller.(n)

programme.title: Brendan Foster: A Life in Athletics
programme.desc: An insight into the career of the broadcaster and former athlete, who won gold as a long distance runner at the European Championships and Commonwealth Games in the 1970s, before going on to become a commentator. Foster has covered nine Olympic Games during his time with the BBC, and is due to retire following the IAAF World Championships, which begin on Friday.(n)

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Hull FC v Leeds Rhinos (Kick-off 2.30pm). Tanya Arnold presents coverage of the opening semi-final, which takes place at Keepmoat Stadium in Doncaster. The Black and Whites are the reigning champions following their victory over Warrington Wolves in last year's final, and they are looking to reach consecutive finals for the first time since the 1980s. The Rhinos have been one of the dominant forces in this competition in recent times, appearing in the final in five of the last seven seasons, and lifting the trophy in both 2014 and 2015 with wins over Castleford Tigers and Hull Kingston Rovers.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: The team values antiques in Gloucester, as experts Catherine Southon and Michael Baggott examine a rare cameo lava brooch from Mount Vesuvius, and a Tibetan ceremonial instrument made from a human leg bone. Plus, Paul Martin meets the young choristers who are following a 500-year-old tradition singing in the cathedral choir.(n)

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: A cabaret singer who once hid out in a convent is reunited with the nuns she befriended, who now need her help. She poses as a member of the order once more and joins the staff of a Catholic school threatened with closure, where she aims to make a success of the resident choir. Comedy sequel, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Najimy, Lauryn Hill, Maggie Smith and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: A sporting-themed edition of the show, featuring snooker commentator Willie Thorne and former golfer Tony Jacklin, darts stars Andy Fordham and Deta Hedman, ex-athletes Tessa Sanderson and Derek Redmond, and rugby union international Nick Easter and former rugby winger Martin Offiah. Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo, actor Tom Davis, actor and musician Shaun Ryder and comedian Henning Wehn, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: Nick Knowles's game show returns after a two-month break to challenges another selection of complete strangers to team up, with each pair battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject. The first couple to win two rounds get to play for £50,000 and each time the champions defeat a new set of opponents their winnings mount up.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Paul Unwin, the man who co-created Casualty back in 1986, returns as a guest writer for an episode that covers the span of an hour within Holby's Emergency Department. Duffy has her hands full as she is shadowed by a pair of school-girls planning to enter the medical profession, and Jez is crippled by guilt after he manages to rescue a woman from a house fire, but did not realise he saved her at the expense of her baby. Meanwhile, Ethan throws himself into his work following the incident with Scott, and when the ailing leader of a marching band arrives feeling unwell, Louise is forced to leave him in triage, with disastrous consequences. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull
programme.desc: The globe-trotting archaeologist teams up with a rebellious teenager who draws him into a search in the Amazon jungle for a mysterious artefact of untold power. But their quest is hindered by Soviet agents, who also want the fabled object for an altogether more sinister purpose. Action adventure sequel, updating the series to a Cold War setting, starring Harrison Ford, Cate Blanchett, Shia LaBeouf, Ray Winstone and John Hurt.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: TV personality Johnny Ball joins Brian Conley to look back at the classic TV that made him the person he is, including the shows he watched every week when he was in the RAF.(n)

programme.title: Wild UK
programme.desc: The wildlife of the mountains, finding out about ravens, the golden eagles of the Scottish hills and asking whether the UK will ever again play host to a long-lost beast - the lynx.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from Leominster, Herefordshire, as Paul Laidlaw and Mark Ashley help the teams raise the most money. Natasha also shows off her favourite ceramic frog.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on how to prune summer flowering shrubs, makes plans for autumn flowers and returns to Dublin to find out how Helen Dillon is progressing in her new garden. Joe Swift shows how good design should not hinder challenging conditions when he visits a garden in Kent, Rachel de Thame explores the vital role of scent in wild flowers and the insects that visit them, and Nick Bailey prepares designs for a weekend project that will transform a front garden into a beautiful and practical space. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven journeys in style to the Lake District, while Julia Bradbury is on two wheels.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner are in north Essex, where they visit the Warner Textile Museum, Colne Valley Railway, and Wash Fruit Farm, with the chef cooking guinea fowl with herbs and a queen of puddings with scented lavender. Plus, chef Jahdre Hayward prepares a dish of cod, with vegetables from his own garden.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes from the BBC archives for party food, including Lorraine Pascale's chocolate lollipops, seafood dishes by James Martin and Rachel Khoo's coq-au-vin on a stick.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: The safari camp reopens after the rainy season, but Saba Douglas-Hamilton worst nightmare is turning into reality. She has a houseful of guests on their way, but the cupboards are bare and there's nowhere for them to sleep. Her husband Frank Pope has problems of his own as he attempts to fit a tracking device to a six-ton bull elephant.(n)

programme.title: Hive Alive
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Martha Kearney conclude their quest with Professor Adam Hart to explore the remarkable secrets of the lives and habits of bees. They discover how many of the tagged insects have survived over the frenetic midsummer week of nectar and pollen gathering and find out if they have collected enough food at this critical time to see them through the winter. They also investigate the deadly mating ritual of a queen and look at how bees can aid medical research, as well as how people can help them in return.(n)

programme.title: Live Swimming: World Championships
programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents coverage of day six from Danube Arena in Budapest, Hungary, which will include the final of the men's 4x200m freestyle relay discipline, as well as the women's 100m freestyle event. With expert analysis from Rebecca Adlington and Mark Foster. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts a game show in which pairs of contestants go head to head attempting to crack a series of passwords, in a bid to win £2,500.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Comic and entertainer Jim Moir - aka Vic Reeves - and his wife Nancy Sorrell take to the road with experts Charlie Ross and Thomas Plant. Traveling through Kent, Jim brings his unique brand of humour to the business of buying antiques, while model and TV presenter Nancy knows a thing or two about bargaining and proves to be very competitive.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys and the famous black chair return for another season of the specialist and general knowledge quiz, as the first batch of 96 contenders start the long journey towards the final. Needless to say, only one can ultimately be crowned Mastermind Champion.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell returns with the quiz show as further teams of three people use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, hoping to succeed reigning champions the Verbivores. Typical rounds they need to negotiate are termed connections, sequences, connecting wall and missing vowels. In this opening edition of the 13th series, three Tolkien fans take on a church team, with one set of clues consisting of pat: bone, rub: disease, nut: spread and salmon: bacteria.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes steps to ensure that fruits and vegetables give maximum cropping by dispensing advice on the summer pruning of fruit trees as well as revealing how to get the best from tomatoes and chillies. He also recommends plants that will carry on flowering into the autumn. Carol Klein meets writer Roy Lancaster as he reminisces on his life. Roy is a former Gardeners' World presenter, and with the programme's half-centenary in mind Rachel de Thame reflects on how people used to garden 50 years ago. Plus, Joe Swift and Flo Headlam help a community create a garden in Wiltshire.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Comedian, novelist and presenter David Baddiel, comedian, actress and writer Cariad Lloyd and stand-up comedian and actor Ross Noble join regular panellist Alan Davies and recently installed host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate questions and facts on the theme `nature and nurture'. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult to crack that points are instead awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Cleverman
programme.desc: Koen seeks help from Aunty Linda to try to restore Kora to her own dimension, while Slade persuades Charlotte to have one last attempt at IVF, but appears to be hiding something.(n)

programme.title: Cleverman
programme.desc: Koen must send Kora back to her own dimension and confront the Namorrodor, while Charlotte realises something is very wrong with her pregnancy. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Men, Boys and Eating Disorders - Panorama.
programme.desc: International rugby union referee Nigel Owens meets men, boys and their families from across the UK to hear their moving accounts of the devastating impact of anorexia and bulimia, as he sets out to investigate the reasons behind why increasing numbers of males are being diagnosed. Nigel also opens up about his own eating disorder for the first time, as he confronts a dark truth about his battle with bulimia.(n)

programme.title: Grandad, Dementia & Me
programme.desc: Moving and intimate documentary following Tom Sivyer and his family after he is diagnosed with vascular dementia in 2014, filmed by his grandson Dominic. Shot over two years, the film captures Tom's rapid mental decline, and the attempts of his family to care for a once fiercely independent and proud man.(n)

programme.title: Growing Up with Cancer
programme.desc: Documentary following the experiences of Natasha, Nairn and Declan as they receive treatment at the Teenage Cancer Trust Unit in Glasgow's Royal Hospital for Children, which offers special spaces for teen patients to listen to music, play video games or watch films with one another. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: When a new artificial intelligence running the sub prevents the Nektons from saving a kayaker because it is too dangerous, Ant must outwit AIMY and save the day.(n)

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: The object Will and Ant are retrieving from the deepest part of the ocean is not what they expected - and now there is a stowaway on the Aronnax trying to take control of it.(n)

programme.title: Herbie Goes to Monte Carlo
programme.desc: The adventurous Volkswagen Beetle is entered in the Trans-Europa race from Paris to Monte Carlo. However, he causes chaos for his driver and mechanic when he falls in love with a rival car, whose owner is unaware her vehicle is alive. Meanwhile, a pair of slippery jewel thieves have secreted their loot in Herbie's petrol tank. Disney comedy adventure sequel, starring Dean Jones, Roy Kinnear, Don Knotts and Julie Sommars.(n)

programme.title: Mars Needs Moms
programme.desc: A nine-year-old boy sees a spacecraft land and kidnap his mother. He stows away on board as the ship travels back to the aliens' Mars homeland. As he tries to rescue her, he learns the Martians have taken her because they need Earth mothers to raise their own children. Animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Seth Robert Dusky, Dan Fogler and Joan Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Irish Escape
programme.desc: As his time as a volunteer comes to an end, Monty Halls tries to retrieve an acoustic listening device holding vital data for the project from the seabed. However, when he fails to find the recording equipment, he realises all his hard work during the past six months might have been wasted. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a terraced house in New Haughton, Derbyshire and a large former care home in Bucknall, Stoke-on-Trent. They then discover what the buyers' paid for the properties and what their plans are for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Nigel and Adam's Farm Kitchen
programme.desc: In the second edition, Nigel Slater and Adam Henson aim to reintroduce the notion of seasonality, something that has largely disappeared now that imports and technology mean people can buy what they want all year round. They use spring lamb, a meat that has become increasingly expensive over the years, with Nigel rescuing the cheaper cuts to show they can be just as tasty. Meanwhile, Adam hopes his wheat will have survived after the coldest spring for 50 years.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Jungle Gremlins of Java.
programme.desc: Primatologist Dr Anna Nekaris travels to the Indonesian island of Java to investigate the slow loris, a creature often considered cute, but possessing a deadly toxic bite unusual in a primate. Heading deeper into the jungle to find out more about its lethal capabilities, she makes a surprising discovery.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys and the famous black chair return for another season of the specialist and general knowledge quiz, as the first batch of 96 contenders start the long journey towards the final. Needless to say, only one can ultimately be crowned Mastermind Champion.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the second of the student quiz's first-round matches, four students from Trinity College, Cambridge, pit their wits against a team from the University of Bristol in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell returns with the quiz show as further teams of three people use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, hoping to succeed reigning champions the Verbivores. Typical rounds they need to negotiate are termed connections, sequences, connecting wall and missing vowels. In this opening edition of the 13th series, three Tolkien fans take on a church team, with one set of clues consisting of pat: bone, rub: disease, nut: spread and salmon: bacteria.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes steps to ensure that fruits and vegetables give maximum cropping by dispensing advice on the summer pruning of fruit trees as well as revealing how to get the best from tomatoes and chillies. He also recommends plants that will carry on flowering into the autumn. Carol Klein meets writer Roy Lancaster as he reminisces on his life. Roy is a former Gardeners' World presenter, and with the programme's half-centenary in mind Rachel de Thame reflects on how people used to garden 50 years ago. Plus, Joe Swift and Flo Headlam help a community create a garden in Wiltshire.(n)

programme.title: Jessica Ennis-Hill and the Next Generation
programme.desc: The former Olympic heptathlon champion profiles some of the future stars of British athletics, ahead of the IAAF World Championships, which begin on Friday. In addition to meeting hammer thrower Sophie Hitchon, middle distance runner Laura Muir, 110m hurdler Andy Pozzi, sprinter Nethaneel Mitchell-Blake and marathon runner Josh Griffiths, Ennis-Hill discusses the expectation and scrutiny placed on sports stars, and reveals what it can be like to deal with pressure in and out of the sporting arena.(n)

programme.title: Live Swimming: World Championships
programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents coverage of day seven from Danube Arena in Budapest, Hungary, which will include the final of the men's 4x100m freestyle relay discipline, as well as the women's 800m freestyle event. With expert analysis from Rebecca Adlington and Mark Foster. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Live coverage of the Prudential RideLondon Classique, which takes place on a 5.5km circuit in central London, taking in some of the city's most famous landmarks. Great Britain's Laura Trott won the inaugural staging of this race in 2013, while Kirsten Wild of the Netherlands claimed victory in the most recent race 12 months ago. Coverage is available on the interactive service from 5.00pm.(n)

programme.title: Proms Extra
programme.desc: Katie Derham hosts another look back at highlights from the past week's performances. This evening, she turns her attention to Walton's Facade from the Malcolm Sargent Prom, and celebrates the work of British composer Scott Walker. Plus, David Owen Norris shares his Chord of the Week.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland
programme.sub-title: Scotland in Miniature: The Isle of Arran.
programme.desc: Paul Murton relives the golden days of Scottish tourism, beginning with a visit to the Isle of Arran. Known as `Scotland in miniature', the diverse destination has something for everyone - ruined castles, rugged mountains, stunning wildlife and even a nudist beach. Along the way he visits King's Cave, Lochranza, Brodick Castle and Kildonan before ending his trip at Cleat's Shore.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: War Weapons Week is to be marked in Walmington-on-Sea by a parade of all auxiliary services, including air-raid wardens, fire brigade, nurses, the rescue squad and of course, the Home Guard. Mainwaring decides the platoon needs a mascot for the event and plumps for a ram, but catching a suitable candidate for the job proves easier said than done. Comedy first broadcast in 1970, starring Arthur Lowe, Clive Dunn and John Le Mesurier.(n)

programme.title: All Families Have Secrets - Patrick Gale's Art of Fiction
programme.desc: Stephen Fry interviews Patrick Gale, the best-selling novelist who first caught his attention 30 years ago, as a rare example of an out gay writer willing to explore the homosexual experience in his work. Here, Fry meets Gale to discuss some of his most popular novels, including Notes from an Exhibition, and Man in an Orange Shirt, a two-part drama telling two parallel love stories set 60 years apart. Gale reveals how he often mines his own family history for inspiration, and details how this new project continues that theme, unveiling a long-held secret about his parents' marriage.(n)

programme.title: Queer as Art
programme.desc: The BBC continues to mark the 50th anniversary of decriminalisation of male homosexuality in the UK with its Gay Britannia season. This time, the focus falls on the LGBT contribution to the arts scene in the past half-decade, as Stephen Fry, David Hockney, Anthony Sher, Alan Cumming, Will Young and Alan Hollinghurst share their perspectives on the distinctive voices the community has brought to British cultural life. Also includes contributions by Val McDermid, Wayne Sleep, Julie Goodyear, Sandi Toksvig, Russell T Davies and many more.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Panellists Julia Zemiro, Matt Lucas and David Mitchell and Alan Davies compete, as Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy quiz show. In this edition, the host meditates on matters medieval and macabre, and as usual, he poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting.(n)

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Fenton Bailey and Randy Barbato present an uncompromising portrait of controversial American photographer Robert Mapplethorpe. Based in New York, Mapplethorpe continually challenged the limits of acceptability via large-scale, highly stylised portraits of typically taboo subjects. His tendency to flirt with obscenity dominated his work until his death in 1989, and as the images he produced gained notoriety, he was posthumously denounced by conservative US senator Jesse Helms, who urged Congressmen to `look at the pictures' he had produced in his lifetime and decide for themselves whether they were suitable for public consumption. Here, Bailey and Barbato explain how Mapplethorpe's artistic flair was not only fuelled by what is now considered to be his genius eye, but also by his insatiable desire for celebrity.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: Known as Flash Harry, Malcolm Sargent was the chief conductor of the Proms for two decades, bringing the concerts to TV audiences for the first time. Marking the 50th anniversary of his death, the BBC Symphony Orchestra, under conductor Andrew Davis, and pianist Beatrice Rana recreate Sargent's 500th Prom from 1966. Alongside Schumann and Berlioz, there's a feast of English music, including works by Elgar and Holst, culminating in Britten's much-loved Young Person's Guide to the Orchestra. Presented by Katie Derham.(n)

programme.title: Chopin Etudes
programme.desc: At Chateau de Neuville near Paris, Freddie Kempf performs Opus 10, No11. Written as piano studies, these are brief but exacting works, designed to test both the technical skill of the pianist and their musical abilities.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Recalling the music of Manchester, where long before the advent of Madchester, the city was serenaded by local outfits Herman's Hermits and the Hollies.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: Jarvis Cocker leads an eclectic line-up in this tribute to the 1960s cult icon Scott Walker. Conductor Jules Buckley has arranged tracks from Walker's four eponymous albums, and here they are performed with live orchestral backing for the very first time, courtesy of Jules Buckley's Heritage Orchestra and London Contemporary Voices. The other performers are Susanne Sundfor, John Grant and Richard Hawley.(n)

programme.title: Reginald D Hunter's Songs of the South
programme.desc: The London-based comedian continues his exploration of the American South through its songs both past and present in Alabama, where he attends a Lynyrd Skynyrd gig and learns about the city of Muscle Shoals' role in the development of soul. Reg then heads to his home state of Georgia, where he visits Athens - where rock bands the B52s and REM originated - and Atlanta, the birthplace of civil rights leader Martin Luther King and rapper Ludacris. Featuring contributions by Arrested Development, St Paul and the Broken Bones, Clarence Carter and Sharon Jones.(n)

programme.title: Elvis: That's Alright Mama 60 Years On
programme.desc: Actor and musician Sam Palladio hosts a musical tribute to Elvis Presley, originally broadcast 60 years after the artist recorded his first single That's All Right at Sun Studios in Memphis, Tennessee. The presenter traces Elvis's story from a childhood spent in poverty to the moment he entered a recording booth to perform the track that would act as a springboard to his success. Featuring performances of a selection of the King of Rock 'n' Roll's finest songs from artists including Candi Staton, the Pierces and Laura Bell Bundy.(n)

programme.title: Country Kings at the BBC
programme.desc: A chronological compilation of performances from the BBC archive by male country singers, ranging from the Everly Brothers and Jerry Lee Lewis to Garth Brooks and Willie Nelson. Featuring classic songs from studio shows by Glen Campbell, Charley Pride, George Hamilton IV, Kenny Rogers, Clint Black, Johnny Cash and Eric Church.(n)

programme.title: Reginald D Hunter's Songs of the South
programme.desc: The London-based comedian continues his exploration of the American South through its songs both past and present in Alabama, where he attends a Lynyrd Skynyrd gig and learns about the city of Muscle Shoals' role in the development of soul. Reg then heads to his home state of Georgia, where he visits Athens - where rock bands the B52s and REM originated - and Atlanta, the birthplace of civil rights leader Martin Luther King and rapper Ludacris. Featuring contributions by Arrested Development, St Paul and the Broken Bones, Clarence Carter and Sharon Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Rockpools
programme.desc: Palaeontologist Professor Richard Fortey explores the species that live within the seaside water formations, some of which have existed for millions of years. He is joined by some of the UK's leading marine biologists at the National Marine Aquarium in Plymouth to reveal new insights into the creatures' lives.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Treasure Islands
programme.desc: Explorer and naturalist Stewart McPherson travels to all the UK's Overseas Territories. His journey begins in Bermuda, in the Atlantic, where he finds ancient castles and a bird that had been thought extinct for more than 300 years. From here he sets out to the centre of the Indian Ocean, to the British Indian Ocean Territory, to find the world's biggest land invertebrate. Half a world away, he eventually reaches Pitcairn Island, lost in the vastness of the Pacific, to meet the descendants of the mutineers from the Bounty.(n)

programme.title: I Know Who You Are
programme.desc: Eva Duran and David Vila secretly observe Juan Elias's therapy sessions, and in a flashback, Alicia reveals she knows about Ana's pregnancy. Spanish thriller, with Francesc Garrido.(n)

programme.title: I Know Who You Are
programme.desc: Alicia and Heredia urge Juan Elias not to take the amnesia test, and another flashback sheds light on the circumstances of Ana's flight. Spanish thriller, starring Francesc Garrido.(n)

programme.title: Rich Hall's Countrier Than You
programme.desc: The American comedian, writer and musician explores the early origins of country music in Nashville and Austin. He visits the rustic studios where this much-loved sound was born and discovers how this genre of music has reinvented itself with influences from bluegrass, western swing and Americana. Rich examines how the music industries differ between these two cities and how they generated their own distinct twist on the genre - such as cosmic country, redneck country and the outlaw artists of the 1970s.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra worries that Ray is happier at work than at home, and persuades him to set up an office in the house. American comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra decides to have a go at writing a children's book, but makes the mistake of asking Ray to help - little realising his competitive streak will jeopardise the entire project. Ray Romano stars.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles meets his brother at Cafe Nervosa, where Frasier reflects on his first year in Seattle - and whether he is actually happy with his life in the city. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Seattle shrink reads a steamy novel written by an old acquaintance from Boston - and discovers his teenage affair with a piano teacher has found its way into the plot. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Eddie impregnates a neighbour's dog, so Frasier decides to have him neutered. However, the elusive mutt has no intention of accepting his fate and flees into the city. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wirth - the CEO of a California ski resort - goes undercover to learn more about his company's working practices as he prepares to merge an existing operation with a new acquisition.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Shamed by his abject failure to score on a test from the National Fatherhood Institute, Homer resolves to become a model parent by helping Bart build a go-kart capable of winning a local race.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Selma tells the family she is getting engaged to her prison pen-pal - none other than Sideshow Bob, who still harbours a grudge against Bart for landing him behind bars in the first place. Featuring the voice of Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The doubles-version of the culinary challenge series heads to North Devon, where busy parents Matt and Sarah are the first hosts, but their decision to serve crisps as canapes does not go down well with some of their rivals. Next up are competitive `foodies' James and Laura, who put together a similar menu to their predecessors - but with more flair. The final party is thrown by am-dram couple Jake and Ian, and their guests' have high expectations that the pair's mushroom bruschetta starter and casserole main look set to miss.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou's manoeuvring skills are put to the test as he drives a client's 40ft motorhome, and the Prestige Pawnbrokers boss also jets off to Marbella, Spain, with gem expert Kristen to value some precious jewellery. A self-confessed shopaholic hopes to sell two modern art paintings to pursue a new career in photography, while a woman decides to get rid of some of her designer handbags to raise cash for her hair extensions business.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the long-running words-and-numbers game, with comedian Jenny Eclair joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: The stubbornness of one juror causes pressure in the jury room as the contenders vie to win up to £10,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman shows Warwickshire couple Lorraine and Neville Bulsara five holiday homes in the Spanish region of La Marina Alta within their budget of £160,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day in the competition sees Andrew and James Widdas from the Rose and Crown confront their critics about their polyester bedding. Nigel and Pok U from the Bingham Townhouse have some explaining to do when it comes to their breakfast service, while Kev and Tor from Float by Boat are left in tears by the payments they receive.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night of the competition in Windsor, Berkshire, car salesman Rob unleashes the mother of all surprises on his guests.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: As the Thanksgiving holiday approaches, Mr Burns hires Homer to amuse him by playing pranks on all and sundry - a situation that upsets Lisa, who has all sorts of old-fashioned ideas about dignity being more important than money.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Everyone arrives back from Ibiza and Neeta has a decision to make. Harry gets a letter that sends him spiralling out of control and Tegan tells Farrah more than she should.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: The young TV viewers offer their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on First Dates, Nature's Weirdest Events and classic movie Dirty Dancing. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Comedians Sara Pascoe and John Cleese join Adam Hills, Alex Brooker and Josh Widdicombe to examine the biggest and most entertaining news stories and round up the main talking points of the week.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of six potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 43-year-old Cathy from Hertfordshire who, with her biological clock ticking, is wanting to settle down and have children. The trouble is she's open to dating men from their 20s to their 60s and finds it hard to choose. Will she find it easier to pick the right partner when they're all naked? Then, 24-year-old Londoner Adam takes centre stage. He hates online dating and has decided to bare all in order to find the perfect match.(n)

programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Alex Zane presents a Top 50 countdown of hilarious, jaw-dropping internet clips featuring the most super-powered online animal moments, from the bear burglar to a gangster crab and the scary truth about how raccoons are taking over the internet.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Team captains Rob Beckett and Aisling Bea are joined by a host of famous faces in this compilation of highlights from the irreverent panel show, hosted by Jimmy Carr.(n)

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: Kate and Wills visit Charles's traditionalist new town, Poundbury in Dorset, where Charles is unveiling another statue of himself. Pippa ponders whether she should leave her fiance Johnny, after she learns that he has lost his fortune and has become a pizza delivery man. Meanwhile, Kate runs into old flame Gypsy Ricky, who reminds her they are still married following a traditional gypsy ritual. Will Camilla use this to destroy Kate in her latest plan to grab power? Starring Harry Enfield, Louise Ford and Hugh Skinner.(n)

programme.title: ATM
programme.desc: Three friends stop off at a cashpoint cubicle on their way home from a party, only to end up under siege. A mysterious hooded figure lurks outside, and kills anyone who tries to gain access to the booth - while also making it clear that anyone attempting to leave will meet a similar fate. Horror, starring Alice Eve and Josh Peck.(n)

programme.title: The Handmaid's Tale
programme.desc: Offred agrees to take on a mission set for her by the May Day movement, but finds the assignment they have in mind is all but impossible. She must return to Jezebels and collect a package that the rebels urgently need. Janine finally cracks when she is forced to give up her baby and move to a new posting, and resorts to drastic action to force the leaders of Gilead to notice the injustice of their society. Serena Joy tries to make a connection with Rita, and begins to suspect her husband of infidelity.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton heads to Chile to look into coloured crisps and find out how these rainbow snacks get their colour. Meanwhile, Jimmy Doherty travels to Spain to investigate one of the trendiest items on our shelves, avocados, and the rapidly rising demand for these fruits which is leading to alarming reports of a crime wave hitting growers.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: A couple from Formby, Lancashire, set out to tone down their bright and bold party house, while another would-be seller seeks to do the opposite by introducing a bit of colour to her muted decor. Meanwhile, a second duo try to update some of the key areas of their home, before all three properties are viewed by two buyers-to-be. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help prospective buyers in Kent search for their ideal homes. In Broadstairs, Caroline and Ian are hoping to find a house for their growing family, while twentysomethings Sophie and Niall are looking for their first property in Maidstone.(n)

programme.title: Mobil 1 The Grid
programme.desc: Max Verstappen provides a tour of the Red Bull factory in Milton Keynes, and Le Mans winners Porsche reveal how data acquisition helps improve the performance of its 919 Hybrid.(n)

programme.title: Motor Sport on 4
programme.sub-title: Motor Sport: Mini Challenge: 2017 Brands Hatch Indy Circuit.
programme.desc: Action from the fifth round of the season, which took place at the Brands Hatch Indy Circuit, where the cars would race at speeds of up to 135mph.(n)

programme.title: Triathlon
programme.desc: Action from the recent event that saw professionals and amateurs in competition. Presented by Anna Woolhouse and Rachel Stringer, with commentary from Patrick Winterton.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray tries to ensure Frank's 65th birthday is memorable by buying him an expensive aquarium just like the one he has always admired in a local Chinese restaurant. Unfortunately, one of the fish dies, sinking the Barone household into gloom and discord.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray reluctantly attends a high-school reunion with Debra, only to discover she had been friends with the in-crowd who made his nerdy teenage years a living hell. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Seattle shrink arranges a date for Daphne with his new radio station manager - unaware he is gay. Comedy, guest starring Eric Lutes, with Kelsey Grammer and Jane Leeves.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles tries to prepare himself for the demands of fatherhood - but soon realises that carrying a 10lb bag of flour around the city streets is no substitute for a real baby. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce and Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's grandmother, known as Meemaw, arrives in Pasadena to visit, but his excitement at her arrival quickly gives way to discomfort when she clashes with Amy. Meanwhile, Raj finds himself drawn to an ambitious female screenwriter he meets at the comic-book store, but Bernadette angrily reminds him he already has a girlfriend. Comedy, guest starring June Squibb.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy host a Valentine's Day episode of Fun with Flags, while Leonard and Penny grapple with getting older. Elsewhere, Howard and Bernadette discover a surprise in their hot tub, and Raj is torn between Emily and a girl he met at the Comic Bookstore. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Bernadette shares some news, the groups' reactions are not what she expected, with Wolowitz freaking out about her announcement. Comedy, Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge helps a former convict fulfil his artistic ambitions by painting a mural at the school, but he soon clashes with Principal Skinner over the design. With the guest voice of Michael Keaton.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and the family set off for a cheap break in Japan, where they get stranded and find themselves forced to take part in a shocking game show to win tickets for the flight home. Featuring the voice of Star Trek veteran George Takei.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa joins Mensa and inspires the local intelligentsia to take over Springfield. Determined to build a better world, they decide to transform the town into a utopia - but go too far and cause a riot. With the guest voice of Stephen Hawking.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Alston House in Cumbria, where owners Michael and Carole Allchorne are brimming with confidence, but Yvonne Copeland and Gail Wells are less than impressed with the decor. The guests are impressed with chef Michael's breakfast, but the hosts are left reeling by the criticisms levelled at their hotel during the feedback session.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Scotia House in Harrogate, where host Marie Lock is hoping her obsessive cleaning regime will give her the edge in the competition. In the rooms, both Michael and Carole and Yvonne and Gail find the deluxe teddy bears freaky, and for Billy and Billy, things are a little on the cosy side. In the afternoon, Marie's keen to show off her moves and pits her guests against each other in a Northern Soul dance off.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Canberra Guest House in Blackpool for the third day of the competition, where host Yvonne Copeland, joined by her part-time helper Gail Wells, hopes her cheap and cheerful B&B will win over her guests. However, Marie finds what she thinks is urine and hair on the toilet seat in her room, and a lack of wi-fi means Billy Junior has to put his business on hold. Yvonne takes her competitors to a local reptile house, but serious divisions unfold within the group, and later, tensions rise again at dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Crown and Kitchen in East Linton, Scotland, owned by father and son Billy and Billy Jr Robertson, who see themselves as the jokers of the pack. Yvonne and Gail leave no mattress unturned in their room inspection, although Michael and Carole are impressed. Later, Yvonne makes quite a splash when the hosts organise an assault course for their guests, but slow service during breakfast leaves the B&Bers disappointed - especially when Billy Jr is at a loss to explain what the problem was.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. Things are tense from the start as Carole and Michael from Alston House challenge Marie on her comments. Next, Marie from Scotia House wants to set the record straight with allegations of tit-for-tat scoring. The group members proceed to thrash out their differences before the week's winners are revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Mike and Amanda Gadd and their two children have always holidayed on the Algarve, a place that holds a special place in their hearts. Mike often works away with his job as a salesman, so they've decided to buy a holiday home there to give them a place to spend quality time together. Ben Hillman shows them five properties around their favourite town of Vilamoura for their £127,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Big House, Little House
programme.desc: A couple in Northamptonshire seek to alter the layout of their home on a budget of £30,000, while another pair in York plan to add a kitchen-diner to their bungalow for £16,000.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.sub-title: Formula 1 Hungarian Grand Prix Qualifying Highlights: 2017.
programme.desc: Steve Jones presents action from the qualifying session at the Hungaroring in Budapest, where the drivers battled for pole position ahead of the 11th round of the season. It was the Mercedes drivers who performed best in qualifying at this track last season, with the now-retired Nico Rosberg claiming pole position, and Lewis Hamilton one place behind in second on the starting grid.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Euro 2017 Live
programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: Germany v Denmark.
programme.desc: Germany v Denmark (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the second quarter-final match, which takes place at Sparta Stadion in Rotterdam, the Netherlands. Both sides secured two wins in the group stages and will be looking to book a spot in Thursday's semi-finals, with Germany hoping to win a remarkable seventh consecutive European title. Subsequent programmes are subject to change.(n)

programme.title: 47 Ronin
programme.desc: A band of samurai is betrayed by a ruthless warlord who murders the warriors' master and banishes them from their homeland. They receive fresh hope in the shape of a mysterious former slave, who leads them into battle against monstrous and magical enemies as they seek to reclaim their former status. Fantasy adventure, starring Keanu Reeves and Hiroyuki Sanada.(n)

programme.title: Puffin Rock
programme.desc: Oona and Otto want to see the Salmon Leap - but first they have a big challenge... get Pip and Pop to go to sleep!.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: Foxy brags about her adventures, and after telling a tale about an enormous golden fish in a little lake, Mofy and Kerry decide to go see it.(n)

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: The rabbit challenges his brother Gaspard to a series of sporting contests and eventually realises that nobody can win all the time.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Bopping About
programme.desc: Derek and Amy are feeling limber as more Milkshakers join Amy outside, as she practises a boptastic limbo dance routine.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Bob and the team build a fitness circuit, Scoop does something he has never done before.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: The Adventure Bay school bus blows all its tyres out, so Ryder volunteers to use the Paw Patroller as a substitute bus. However, the kids hop into the pups' vehicles and drive off.(n)

programme.desc: When Mum Hooman comes home with bubbles for the youngsters, the Floogals think that they are made by a magic wand.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and the panel debate the day's issues before opening the discussion to the studio audience and inviting viewers to call in or text their opinions.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Julian Norton is dispatched to a local petting farm to tend to a goat with a suspected broken leg, but he quickly realises his patient has a bad temper, and is not particularly keen on receiving treatment. Meanwhile, things seem grave when Peter Wright receives an emergency call from the anxious trainer of a horse that has cut open its hoof while grazing in a field. Back at the surgery, a pregnant dog comes round from her anaesthetic while undergoing a emergency Caesarian, and further problems arise when she seems to take no interest in her puppies. Plus, Julian and Peter take an afternoon off to attend the Great Yorkshire Show, where they bump into clients old and new.(n)

programme.desc: Olivia is shocked to learn Irene has been secretly visiting Mick, while Tori regards Ash in a new light as Luc's condition improves. John realises it is time to return home.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Tyler's mood takes a dive when Mark gets a text from their mother to advise that she is flying in for a visit. Meanwhile, Steph feels uneasy about the kiss with Jack.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.sub-title: NCIS: Murder in the Family: Agent Afloat.
programme.desc: A lieutenant apparently commits suicide by jumping from an aircraft carrier and Ziva and McGee are dispatched to inform the widow - but arrive to find that she has been killed. Subsequent inquiries reveal that the injuries on her body were inflicted after death and the murder scene was carefully staged to mislead investigators. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: A Father's Secret
programme.desc: Ambitious young attorney Carrie aspires to become a partner like her fiance, and eagerly accepts a billion-dollar wrongful death case in a bid to improve her standing in the legal profession. However, when the job brings her into contact with sensitive information, she discovers some disturbing facts about her boss - and her family. As things progress, Carrie finds both her career and her freedom in jeopardy. Thriller, starring Willa Ford.(n)

programme.title: Cricket on 5
programme.sub-title: England v South Africa: Third Test Day Two.
programme.desc: England v South Africa. Highlights of the second day's play in the Third Test of the four-match series, which took place at The Oval in London. The Proteas will be looking to emulate their most recent performance on this ground in July 2012, when they won by an innings and 12 runs, thanks largely to an outstanding batting display by Hashim Amla, who scored 311 not out.(n)

programme.title: Drain the Bermuda Triangle
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the infamous disappearances of ships and aircraft, adopting the rather unorthodox technique of exploring the area's ominous reputation by `draining the water from it' to see what exactly lies below the surface of the mythical triangle. Data from sophisticated sonar surveys enables the ocean floor to be seen, revealing strange geological features. The programme then contemplates whether they have had any influence on the mysterious occurrences that have been documented over the years.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: After almost eight weeks, Emma Willis reveals the result of the public vote to choose the winner of Big Brother 2017. Whittling them down one by one, Emma leads the runners-up quickly through the best and worst of their time on Big Brother, until there is only one remaining. She chats to the winner about life in the house, why they think they have won and how it feels to be back in the outside world. There'll also be a roll-call of all the evictees from the series and a speedy look at what the housemates got up to yesterday. And fans needn't worry - the normal series may be over for another year, but Celebrity Big Brother promises to return soon.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal talks to the winner and runners-up, and Emma Willis drops in to give her thoughts on the final and this year's series as a whole. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Lip Sync Battle
programme.desc: The series' executive producer Stephen Merchant decides to leap into the fray himself, presenting his rendition of Christina Aguilera's hit song Dirrty. Taking Stephen on is singer and actress Malin Akerman, who mimes to Talk Dirty by Jason Derulo. Presented by LL Cool J, with commentary from supermodel co-host Chrissy Teigen.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.desc: The Axle City Grand Prix arrives, and Gabby develops a remote control that can manipulate any machine in town - but then Crusher steals it, and rigs the race in his favour.(n)

programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Sticky Putty.
programme.desc: Noddy realises that someone has put sticky putty on Clockwork Mouse's key, and comes up with a clever solution when he finds out who did it and why.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: The little girl, Peggy pingwing, Otis the oxpecker, and Gertie the giraffe try to help Ritchie the ostrich to fly.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The Wise Old Elf fears an alien invasion after something resembling a shooting star lands in the Little Kingdom.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder: Mega Machines
programme.desc: Premiere. A feature-length edition of the construction-site animation, in which Bob builds a dam to give Spring City fresh water. With the voices of Lee Ingleby and Brian Cox.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.desc: Iain Lee narrates a compilation of comical clips involving cats getting up to no good. With contributions from comedians Dave Spikey, Matt Richardson, Zoe Lyons and Ellie Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers are forced to exercise caution when they stop an uninsured driver who is known to have a violent past, while Jon Peacock and police dog Brad are on the hunt for suspected burglars. Sarah Capes gets a whiff of something illegal, Mike Templeman pulls over a white van with rather too many faults and one unlucky driver discovers that there is no fooling Dan Brigginshaw.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The hunt for a suspected burglar takes an unexpected turn, a late-night stop reveals a bag of drugs, Jon Peacock has a tussle with a fallen tree and Barry Peach deals with a case of some very hot dogs locked inside a car.(n)

programme.title: The Time Machine
programme.desc: A 19th-century scientist resolves to prove time travel is possible - and when his fiancee is killed, he embarks on a challenging mission to change the course of history. However, although his time machine works, he is still unable to alter past events - and as he journeys into the future, he finds himself in a terrifying situation. Sci-fi adventure, based on the HG Wells novel, with Guy Pearce and Samantha Mumba.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: A dispute with the residents of a mobile home leads to a man being attacked with a hammer, and a woman decides to tackle a dog mess problem in the communal area of her council block. The programme also follows the attempts of a couple to find evidence that their neighbour is subjecting them to a psychological campaign of terror.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: A dispute between households arising from investments made into a business venture that later failed, and the fury surrounding the construction of an extension that saw damage to an adjacent property. Plus, updates on people and stories featured in previous programmes, including the latest whereabouts of rowdy rapper Elvis Turasinze, who drove his neighbours berserk with his beat-making.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Paul and Steve's first job is an eviction with a twist when they find out the landlord is the tenant's mother, while their next case is also tricky and involves family members with a question mark over their immigration status who are now facing homelessness. Their final case involves a man with a history of mental illness who has reached the end of his tenancy but refuses to leave, and Steve tries to find a solution after a church minister and his mother fail to placate him.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary series giving an insight into the world of debt collection. Kevin Stokes and Brian O'Shaughnessy try to collect a debt from a technology company, but with the director nowhere to be seen, the office manager does everything she can to prove the business is no longer trading. Stewart McCracken and Elmor Victor face a heartbreaking house repossession in Merseyside, where two landlords are forced to evict a tenant recovering from a brain tumour which has cost him his job and income.(n)

programme.title: Cricket on 5
programme.sub-title: England v South Africa: Third Test Day Three.
programme.desc: England v South Africa. Highlights of the third day's play in the Third Test of the four-match series, which took place at The Oval in London.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Live Boxing
programme.sub-title: Carl Frampton v Andres Gutierrez - Undercard.
programme.desc: Coverage from the SSE Arena in Belfast, ahead of the main event between Carl Frampton and Andres Gutierrez.(n)

programme.title: FIA Formula E Live
programme.desc: The first Montreal ePrix race. Coverage of the first of two races staged at the Montreal Street Circuit, which serves as the 11th and penultimate round of the season. This is a brand new circuit set in the centre of the Canadian city, and features 14 turns in a lap that is 2.75km long.(n)

programme.title: Live Boxing
programme.desc: Carl Frampton v Andres Gutierrez. Coverage of the featherweight bout from SSE Arena in Belfast, as The Jackal returns to the ring for the first time since losing his world title to Leo Santa Cruz back in January. After suffering the first defeat of his professional career last time out, Frampton now faces a hard-punching Mexican with a record of 25 knockouts in 35 victories, with only one loss and one draw to his name.(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of climbers successfully scale Mount Everest, only to be faced with tragedy when a monster snowstorm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: Powerhouse performances by Leonardo DiCaprio and Russell Crowe ignite this charged international-espionage thriller. DiCaprio's a dedicated CIA field operative in Jordan on the trail of a terrorist, and Crowe is a manipulative stateside agent aiding him in his quest. DiCaprio tries to lure the bomber out of hiding, but discovers that the deeper in he gets, the harder it may be to get out alive. Directed by Ridley Scott from a script by William Monahan, who adapted David Ignatius's book(n)

programme.title: The Conspirator
programme.desc: In this stunning drama, a lawyer (James McAvoy) defends Mary Surratt from charges of acting in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln, and he realizes that she's being used as bait to capture her son, the only conspirator to have eluded justice. Directed by Robert Redford(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Based on the life of legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens, who became the greatest track and field athlete in history at the world stage of the 1936 Olympics by winning four gold medals. He achieved this amazing feat under the gaze of Adolf Hitler(n)

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: Top-notch performances by Ben Affleck and Samuel L. Jackson drive this riveting drama about a fender bender that sparks a dangerous game of cat and mouse between two motorists. An intense story of vengeance and redemption!(n)

programme.title: Alien Resurrection
programme.desc: A replicated Ripley battles mutant DNA and slime-dripping fiends in Sigourney Weaver's fourth sci-fi skirmish. Contains strong language, violence, flashing images(n)

programme.title: Any Given Sunday
programme.desc: 'On any given Sunday you're gonna win or you're gonna lose. The point is - can you win or lose like a man?' Macho stuff from director Oliver Stone, with a cast of heavyweights from both cinema and pro sport(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: In this hip reboot of the comic-book franchise, a brilliant scientist builds a device that allows users to teleport to an alternate dimension, but an experiment involving it goes wrong and leaves him and his three teammates with unusual superpowers. The quartet are then forced to work together to battle an enemy from their past(n)

programme.title: The Vanishing
programme.desc: When Jeff's girlfriend is abducted by a highly intelligent psychopath, his only hope of finding her is to put himself in the kidnapper's hands(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: After discovering the truth about their walled city and breaking down its faction system, Tris and Four lead a journey out of Chicago to learn more about who has been manipulating their civilization in this thrilling entry in the YA adventure series. But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind(n)

programme.title: Alien Resurrection
programme.desc: A replicated Ripley battles mutant DNA and slime-dripping fiends in Sigourney Weaver's fourth sci-fi skirmish. Contains strong language, violence, flashing images(n)

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: A maverick CIA agent forges an unlikely bond with a pickpocket after the latter is framed for a bombing in Paris. Soon, they combine their brawn and street smarts to investigate a terrorist conspiracy targeting the city's Bastille Day celebrations(n)

programme.title: Vigilante Diaries
programme.desc: A team of crime fighters travel the globe as they battle a group of spies, the Armenian mob and a trio of mysterious women with dark intentions(n)

programme.title: Tango & Cash
programme.desc: Ray Tango is a Los Angeles narcotics cop who dresses in fancy suits, wears wire-rim glasses, and talks to his stockbroker more than he talks to his mother. Gabriel Cash is another Los Angeles narcotics cop who has long, dishevelled blonde hair and dresses in worn-out sweatshirts. Together, Tango and Cash are the two best narcs in LA, which causes drug baron Yves Perret no end of distress(n)

programme.title: The Mark of Zorro
programme.desc: Accepted into the Library of Congress for preservation, this swashbuckling American adventure picture stars Tyrone Power as Zorro, Linda Darnell as the beautiful love interest and Basil Rathbone as the villain!(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: Since childhood, Benjamin Franklin Gates has known that he is descended from a long line of people whose job it is to guard a treasure hidden by the Founding Fathers, who hid clues to its whereabouts in the country's currency and on the back of the Declaration of Independence. Now, he has learned of a plot to steal the Declaration, and has only one option - steal it himself. Even if he pulls off this monumental task, keeping the treasure safe is still going to be incredibly hard, especially since the FBI has also had wind of the scheme(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: Third in the series of high-speed action thrillers about maverick New York cop John McClane. This time the death-defying lawman, under suspension from the force, goes up against a madman who is threatening to detonate bombs all over Manhattan. McClane pulls out all the stops as he races against the clock to save the city. En route, a hostile Harlem shopkeeper becomes his reluctant partner in the adventure(n)

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax
programme.desc: A young lad survives a catastrophic event on his ninth birthday. A doctor examines the extraordinary accident and the instances that affected his life(n)

programme.title: Coyote Ugly
programme.desc: An aspiring singer-songwriter works in a trendy Manhattan bar where the employees are expected to put on a spirited show for patrons(n)

programme.title: The Informant!
programme.desc: A high-level executive blows the whistle on his corrupt employers, but as he gathers inside information the FBI discover he might not be the most reliable source(n)

programme.title: Role Models
programme.desc: After getting arrested, drinks salesmen Danny and Wheeler are forced to mentor two troubled kids. But who's learning from whom?(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: Six eligible people in New York City seek for the perfect partner as they learn to be single in a world where the meaning of love seems to change all the time(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Successful and single businesswoman Kate Holbrook is finally determined to have a kid on her own now that she is 37. But when she discovers that she has only a million-to-one chance of getting pregnant, the driven Kate finds in working girl Angie Ostrowiski an unlikely surrogate. Everything is apparently going well. That until Angie shows up at Kate doorstep with no place to live. The two opposites try to get along and, in the middle of their tug-of-war, they discover that there can be a different kind of family(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two daffy adult sisters throw one last raging party in their childhood home before it's sold by their parents, with disastrous results(n)

He crashes it and ends up meeting Flexo, a joking robot that looks just like Bender only he has a goatee. Bender and Flexo become friends and go to the robot strip club, but Fry thinks that he's evil. He joins the Planet Express crew on a sensitive mission to deliver an important atom to the Miss Universe Pageant. Fry stays up all night to watch over Flexo, but he ends up falling asleep during his own shift. When they get to the pageant, the atom has been stolen and Flexo is gone. Bender immediately joins the league and wins a lot of matches because he's popular. When he starts to lose his public appeal, he asks Leela to coach him for the big match against the giant robot Destructor. She agrees because she has a grudge against Destructor's coach, Phnog, who is also her old martial arts instructor. programme.title: We're the Millers
programme.desc: A low-level pot dealer poses as a family man in order to pay back a debt to his supplier in this comedy starring Saturday Night Live alumni Jason Sudeikis. If you're a soccer mom in search of some reefer, David Burke (Sudeikis) is just the man to talk to. He certainly isn't the biggest dealer in town, but he's discreet, and aims to please. When David attempts to perform a good deed and gets robbed in the process, however, his supplier Brad (Ed Helms) is none too happy. Now, in order to pay Brad back before the hammer drops, David must retrieve a big drug shipment from Mexico and sneak back across the border undetected. It's a risky job for sure, but with the help of a few neighbors David might just pull it off. With sardonic stripper Rose (Jennifer Aniston) assuming the role of housewife, teenage misfit Kenny (Will Poulter) posing as the awkward son, and rebellious Casey (Emma Roberts) filling in as his sister, David slips on some khakis, and starts heading south. Meanwhile, as David tries to convince himself that the border patrol wouldn't give a second glance at such a typical suburban family, the shipment -- and the stakes -- both prove greater than anticipated. Nick Offerman, Kathryn Hahn, and Ken Marino co-star(n)

To make matters more complicated, all three presenters are racing not only one another but also the Stig, who is making his way toward the finish line by public transport. Plus, the new Lamborghini Huracan is put through its paces and singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran takes to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.desc: Two weeks military leave is all it takes for US Army Staff Sergeant John Tyree and college student Savannah Curtis to fall in love in this Lasse Hallström-directed adaptation of Nicholas Sparks' (The Notebook) novel. Having depended on letters to keep their romance alive, their relationship falters when John unexpectedly decides to re-enlist in the army following the September 11 attacks in New York. Then it arrives - the Dear John letter informing him that Savannah is engaged to someone else. With no hope of being together, John rededicates himself to the military, surviving injury and only seeing Savannah when family events force him to return home. Months later, John receives another letter from Savannah with their sign-off of old, 'I'll see you soon, then'. Could there be hope for the couple yet?(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
